newsitem.title: YEMEN: Fishing company formed in Yemen.
newsitem.headline: Fishing company formed in Yemen.

text.p: A private sector 2.86 billion rial ($28.6 million) fishing company was on Friday formed in Yemen.
The firm, a joint-venture between Yemeni and foreign investors, was named Yemen Fishing and Marine Life Company, officials in this southern port city said.
The company has been under formation for the past year but legal and administrative steps were completed on Friday with the election of a board of directors.
Officials said the Aden-based company is Yemen's first private sector firm in the fishing sector.
Founding members hold 40 percent of the company's shares while 60 percent of the 100 rial face value shares were sold in a public subscription.
Impoverished Yemen is currently implementing the second phase of a plan agreed with the World Bank and the International Monetary Fund to reform and liberalise the economy.
